events.title: Strategic Shift: 7th Indian Brigade Diverts to Face Enemy Tank Columns, Bengasi Evacuation Ordered
events.description: On the 28th January it became clear that the enemy’s next objective was Bengasi. The 7th Indian Infantry Brigade was on its way to attack the force above the escarpment, which had now turned north and was heading for El Abiar, when two columns, each said to contain a considerable number of enemy tanks, were observed moving northwards along the coast towards Solluch. The 7th Indian Infantry Brigade was obliged to turn and deal with these columns and to abandon the attempt to attack the force moving on El Abiar, which captured Regima about noon. General Tuker then obtained permission to evacuate Bengasi, as the 1st Armoured Division was already committed in the opposite direction and would not be able to intervene.

events.title: Tragedy Strikes as Major-General Barstow Killed in Ambush; Indian Division Faces Dire Challenges
events.description: On the railway front disaster overtook the 9 Indian Division on the 28th January. A wide gap developed in the Layang Layang area between the 22 Indian Infantry Brigade, which was forward, and the 8 Indian Infantry Brigade which was supporting it. Into this gap enemy troops penetrated having moved round the eastern flank by estate roads. events.title: Westforce Plans Strategic Withdrawal: New Positions to be Held Until Late January
events.description: (b) Westforce to withdraw to-night to the general line S. Sayong Halt—S. Benut. This position to be held until the night 27-28th January at least. Subsequent with‘drawals to take place to positions, to be laid down in advance, which would in turn be held for a minimum fixed period and longer if possible.

events.title: Admiral Fraser Submits Key Despatch to Lords Commissioners in January 1944
events.description: The accompanying Despatch was submitted on the 28th January, 1944, to the Lords Commissioners of the Rang ort by Admiral Sir Bruce A. Fraser, K.C.B BB, Commander-in-Chief, Home Fleet.

events.title: Heroic Rescue: Survivors of Seychelles Tanker Torpedoing Found After Marathon Air Search
events.description: 111. Survivors of a tanker torpedoed in the Seychelles area were located and rescued as a result of continuous sorties flown from the 28th January to 30th January. One Catalina crew fiew for forty-two hours on the 29th-30th

events.title: Roth Indian Infantry Brigade Executes Unscathed Cross-Country Move Amidst Rising Threats to Barentu
events.description: The cross-country move of roth Indian Infantry Brigade, which had one and a half field regiments and one troop of 6-inch howitzers under command, was carried out without interference from the enemy. Barentu was threatened from the north by 28th January as well as from the west.

events.title: Singapore Fortifies Defense as Troop Convoys Arrive Amid Rising Tensions
events.description: 310. Special attention, as the directive instructed, continued to be paid to the provision of protection for reinforcing convoys arriving at Singapore. Further convoys came in on 22nd, 24th and 28th January, bringing ‘the remainder of the 18th Division, except for a few units, a Brigade Group from India, two to three thousand troops from Australia, and more anti-aircraft units.

events.title: Air Forces Mobilize for Strategic Landing Amidst Night Bombing Campaign
events.description: 422. On the 26th January the Endau landing took place (paras. 332-339) and No. 225 (B) Group was ordered to despatch all available aircraft to the scene. A force of 6 Hudsons from No. 62 (B) Squadron and 5 Blenheim I’s of the same squadron but manned by No. 84 (B) Squadron aircrews was scraped up. The Hudsons arrived on the scene during the late afternoon, and landed at Sembawang for the night, returning to Palembang on the 27th January. The Blenheims arrived too late to participate, and so were ordered to land at Tengah and await orders from A.HQ. This force was used on the night 27th-28th January to bomb Kuantan, returning to Palembang on 28th January.
